definition: to lead (sb, or an animal) away/to collect (e.g. a child left in sb's care beforehand)/to take away
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: I need to see if check number 212 has cleared yet.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道有一张212号的支票的钱是否被领走了。

sentences.english: Approximately ten minutes later, Mou the father rushes , takes away it.
sentences.chinese: 约十分钟后，牟某的父亲赶到，将其领走。

sentences.english: By the time we arrived at the shelter both those dogs were gone.
sentences.chinese: 等我们赶到收容所时，这两只狗都已经被领走了。

definition: to claim (as one's property)/to adopt (a child)/to accept (an illegitimate child as one's own)
to build up from nothing/to start from scratch
to apply (for a job)/to reply to a job advertisement
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
